docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, April 15.--Bolivia has notified Uruguay that Rogelio Ibarra is persona grata as the future Paraguayan Minister at La Paz. Senor Ibarra was formerly Paraguayan Minister of Foreign Affairs and more recently Paraguayan Minister at Rio de...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, April 15.--Bolivia has notified Uruguay that Rogelio Ibarra is persona grata as the future Paraguayan Minister at La Paz. Senor Ibarra was formerly Paraguayan Minister of Foreign Affairs and more recently Paraguayan Minister at Rio de Janeiro.
docs.abstract: Bolivia notifies Uruguay that R Ibarra is acceptable as Paraguayan Min; Uruguayan's part in negotiations lauded by South Amer newspapers

headline.main: BOLIVIA APPROVES PARAGUAYAN ENVOY; Notifies Uruguay That Choice Is Acceptable, Opening Way to Renewal of Relations May 1.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

headline.main: TOPICS IN WALL STREET.; News, Comment and Incident, On the Stock Exchange and In the Financial Markets. Flight From the Pound. The Week's New Financing. State Bonds off the Market. Copper and the Utilities. Money Rates and the Exchanges. Mid-Month Money Market. For the Short Lines. Quarterly Reports Watched.

docs.snippet: Manufacturers' and wholesalers' sales were reported good in only three of 100 market centres of the country covered in a survey conducted by Credit Monthly Magazine, the publication of the National Association of Credit men, it was announced...
docs.lead_paragraph: Manufacturers' and wholesalers' sales were reported good in only three of 100 market centres of the country covered in a survey conducted by Credit Monthly Magazine, the publication of the National Association of Credit men, it was announced yesterday.

headline.main: SALES CALLED GOOD IN ONLY 3 MARKETS; Survey by Credit Organ Shows Wholesalers in 66 Cities Doing Fair Trade. COLLECTIONS ALSO OFF Only 4 Out of 104 Centres Reported Them Good--Latin-American Survey Made.

docs.snippet: SAN JUAN, P.R., April 12.--Porto Rico could gain its political independence if only Porto Ricans would refuse to hold office under American rule, according to Pedro Albizu Campos, one of the most militant advocates of island independence.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN JUAN, P.R., April 12.--Porto Rico could gain its political independence if only Porto Ricans would refuse to hold office under American rule, according to Pedro Albizu Campos, one of the most militant advocates of island independence.
docs.abstract: Symposium of P R pol status

headline.main: PORTO RICANS URGED TO PEACEFUL REVOLT; Islanders Advised to Refuse Office Under Our Rule in Move for Independence. FREE STATE SUGGESTED Speakers at University Symposium Advocate Various Plans for Political Change. Revenue Argument Unsound. Urges Free State Status.

byline.original: By HARWOOD HULL. Special Correspondence, THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: THE Hudson Motor Car Company has been conducting a demonstration of its "Great Eight,"  which included the removal of the gear-shift lever while the car was running in high. The motor's performance in high gear, under all traffic and road conditions,...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE Hudson Motor Car Company has been conducting a demonstration of its "Great Eight," which included the removal of the gear-shift lever while the car was running in high. The motor's performance in high gear, under all traffic and road conditions, was thus emphasized.

headline.main: MOTORS AND MOTOR MEN; New Diamond T Truck. McCarty Returns to Nash. 1,000th Cadillac V-16. Maharajah Buys Stutz. Golf Tournament Arranged. Brooklyn Dealers Elect. Durant Demonstration.
